title: Nelson A. Rockefeller gubernatorial records, Press Office, Series 25
finding_aid_title: A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial records, Press Office, Series 25
finding_aid_filing_title: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) Gubernatorial records, Press Office, Series 25

revision_statements.date: finding aid revision date not supplied
revision_statements.description: <date>30 June 2010</date><item>Migrated from Re:discovery to the Archivists' Toolkit by Becky Robbins.</item>

subnotes.content: Nelson A. Rockefeller served as governor of New York from January 1, 1959, to December 18, 1973. He was the first person elected to four consecutive four-year terms as a state governor.

Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at <extref href="http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php">http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php</extref>

RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of U.S. copyright law. Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with "fair use." If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection or items within a collection, it is the user's responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

This series is divided into 9 subseries:

Subseries 1 - Public Relations Files
Subseries 2 - Latin American Mission
Subseries 3 - Agency and Commission Reports
Subseries 4 - Positions and Policy Papers
Subseries 5 - Political and Election Analysis Files
Subseries 6 - County Visits
Subseries 7 - Recommendations to Fill U.S. Senate Seat Following Robert F. Kennedy's Assassination, 1968
Subseries 8 - Miscellaneous
Subseries 9 - Statements and Press Releases

The material in this series was created and maintained by Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller's Press Office. The series includes copies of press releases documenting his governmental and political activities and some background material used in the creation of the releases. Also included is a small collection of statistical analysis reports used by the Governor's office to gauge public opinion on various issues.

Detailed finding aids for each series of this collection are available:
